data.title: 2 charged, father arrested in connection to Stark County shooting death of 7-year-old
data.meta_description: A man is charged in connection to a shooting that took the life of his own biological son in Stark County, according to investigators.
data.text:
STARK COUNTY, Ohio (WOIO) - Two people have been charged in connection to a shooting that took the life of his biological son in Stark County, according to investigators.

Stark County Sheriff’s Deputies say they arrived at the Knights Inn Motel, located at 3950 Convenience Dr. in Plain Township around 1 a.m. for the shooting.

Deputies say they found the 7-year-old boy shot inside the motel room.

Deputies say the Plain Township Fire Department transported the child to Cleveland Clinic Mercy Hospital, where the boy died from his injuries.

Deputies say they identified the suspect as William Dolch, 37, of Akron, and he is the victim’s biological father.

Dolch was arrested Friday afternoon in Canton at a drug house in the 2700 block of 8th Street NW, U.S. Marshals officials confirmed. He faces reckless homicide, endangering children, and tampering with evidence charges.

He previously was charged with weapons under disability.

The Stark County Sheriff’s Office released a statement Friday afternoon saying a second person has been charged in connection to the boy’s death.

Officials say 29-year-old Brittany Franko has been charged with complicity to commit reckless homicide, endangering children, and obstructing official business. Franko is the girlfriend of Dolch, according to police.

The sheriff said they believe Franko was trying to help Dolch cover up the crime.

Deputies say five people, two adults and three children, were inside the motel room at the time of the shooting.

“Every loss of life is a profound tragedy, and it is particularly difficult when a child is involved,” said Stark County Sheriff George T. Maier. “Our deepest sympathies are with the family and the entire community. Such incidents weigh heavily on everyone including our first responders.”

According to the complaint filed in the Canton Municipal Court, Dolch was previously convicted on a third-degree felonious drug trafficking charge out of Medina.

Medina County Court records say he pleaded guilty in 2007 to the charge.

A sheriff’s office spokesperson says the shooting remains under investigation.

Anyone with information is asked to call the Stark County Sheriff’s Office Detective Bureau at 330-430-3800 ext. 0.

This is a developing story. Return to 19 News for updates
